raw_comment:
More people ages 15-24 years old believe that the world is becoming a better place; whereas, less people who are age 40 or older believe the world is becoming a better place. This means that the younger generations are more optimistic than the older generations. I also noticed that less developed countries are more optimistic than some developed countries. 

I wonder if the less developed countries are more optimistic because their quality of life is increasing and they have different point of view than people in developed countries? I also wonder what the definition of "the world is getting better with each generation" because that could be different in people's opinion. 

This relates to the community around me because I am in the 15-24 year old age group and I could relate to them. It also shows me what my generation thinks of the world compared to my parents generations. 

"Is the World Becoming a Better Place?"
